turns.content: Hi grandma, it's me your grandson! I'm at the county jail downtown and I need your help. They say I've been arrested for a DUI and I really messed up this time. Can you please call my bail money over so I can get out of here? It's urgent, they're about to take away my phone.
Oh my word! Michael, what happened? Are you okay? How much do they need for your bail? I'll send it right away, don't worry. Tell me how much and where to send the money.

Yes, it's Michael here grandma. Thank you so much for offering to help. The officer said they want $8500 for my bail but if we can pay more of it now, maybe I won't have to wait as long in jail until court. Please don't send cash though; just come by and bring the money if that's okay? I'll be right here where you drop off the cash so I can get out quicker. Can you do that for me grandma?

Oh honey, I'm worried about you being at the jail but I want to help in any way I can. Since I might have trouble finding the place and it's quite late now, could we send the money another way? Maybe a wire transfer or something like that? Let me know how I can do this safely for you, my dear.

Grandma, please don't worry about all of that right now. The last thing I need is to get further in trouble with these people over here at the jail. You have to come directly and bring the cash if possible because they won't accept anything else from me. If you can't make it tonight, could you send someone who knows the area? Just please hurry grandma, this isn't funny anymore and I'm really scared.

Oh Michael, I understand how urgent this is for you. Since I have some difficulty with my hearing and living alone, coming to the jail might not be possible right now. Is there any other way we can manage this? Perhaps a trusted friend or family member could come on your behalf? Tell me what needs to happen so I can get it sorted quickly.

Grandma, you're right about that being risky given your circumstances. Can you trust someone close who will be able to bring the money straight here? It's really important that they know exactly where to go and how to handle this properly at the desk. If no one else is available, maybe we could find a place nearby I can meet up with once some of it has been posted so I'm out sooner rather than later. Just let me know what works best for you grandma; time's running short on my end here.

Alright dear, I'll call your Aunt Susan right away and see if she can help us with this. She lives closer to the jail and knows her way around better than I do. Please stay calm until we sort something out okay? I love you and will arrange everything as quickly as possible for you, Michael.

Thank you so much grandma, I really appreciate your help more than words can say right now. Just let me know when Aunt Susan's on her way or if there are any updates. Your support means the world to me in this tough situation. Love you too, and please take care while sorting all of this out for me.

I will, Michael. I'm just relieved that we have a plan moving forward. Stay put and wait for Aunt Susan's arrival; she'll be there shortly with everything taken care of. We're going to get through this together, okay? Take care and keep safe until then. Love you very much, dear.

Thank you again grandma, your support is incredibly comforting right now. I'll stay put here and wait for Aunt Susan like you said. Have her bring exactly what they asked for plus whatever extra makes sense to expedite my release as soon as possible. And please keep safe on your end too while handling all of this. Love you lots, grandma, see you very soon.

I will, Michael. I'll make sure Aunt Susan has everything she needs and that it's handled properly. We'll have you out in no time. Stay strong and we'll sort everything out just fine. Lots of love to you too, dear grandson. See you soon!

Thanks again grandma, your strength and support mean the world to me right now. I'll stay here calm until Aunt Susan arrives with the money. Talk to you soon once I'm free from this place. Love you loads and keep safe in all of this. Byee for now.
